detaileddescription.para: Get things to compile in Glib < 2.8
Start running the mainloop for gnt.
Check whether the terminal is capable of UTF8 display.

simplesect.para: FALSE if the terminal is capable of drawing UTF-8, TRUE otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Present a window. If the event was triggered because of user interaction, the window is moved to the foreground. Otherwise, the Urgent hint is set.

parameterdescription.para: The new name for the widget.

detaileddescription.para: Check whether a widget has focus.

simplesect.para: TRUE if the widget has the current focus, FALSE otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Set the URGENT hint for a widget.

parameterdescription.para: The widget to set the URGENT hint for.
The user-visible label for the action.
The callback function for the action.

simplesect.para: TRUE if the menu is displayed, FALSE otherwise (e.g., if another menu is currently displayed).

detaileddescription.para: Get the string in the clipboard.

simplesect.para: A copy of the string in the clipboard. The caller must g_free the string.

detaileddescription.para: Set the contents of the global clipboard.

parameterdescription.para: The new content of the new clipboard.

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *wd, char **argv, char **envp, gint *stin, gint *stout, gint *sterr, void(*callback)(int status, gpointer data), gpointer data)
memberdef.name: gnt_giveup_console

detaileddescription.para: Spawn a different application that will consume the console.

parameterdescription.para: The working directory for the new application.
Location to store the child's stdin, or NULL.
Location to store the child's stdout, or NULL.
Location to store the child's stderr, or NULL.
The callback to call after the child exits.
The data to pass to the callback.

simplesect.para: TRUE if the child was successfully spawned, FALSE otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Check whether a child process is in control of the current terminal.

simplesect.para: TRUE if a child process (eg., PAGER) is occupying the current terminal, FALSE otherwise.
